lexUnit.name: heart-rending.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: causing great sadness or distress.

sentence.text: In some ways this is a heart-rending book , for there is no doubting Benn 's single-minded commitment to his adopted class .
In a heart-rending telephone call to a US television station , Mrs Dragseth said the US embassy was of no help , and it seemed incompetent even to register the fact of his abduction .
We sang together those heart-rending popular songs about the season : ` The Autumn Leaves " and Trenet 's French version from which it was taken .

Councillors received many heart-rending pleas from families who were being forced into emigration as the only alternative to their miserable and expensive accommodation ; complaints about rat infestation were not infrequent .
During the heart-rending scenes , viewers were told thousands would die unless the Red Cross could raise £2 million by February .
Their happiness was to be destroyed by the heart-rending realisation that Kimberly was not his child .
The heart-rending description of Mozart 's death was left by Sophie , Constanze 's younger sister .
He can turn his head away from the screams , the pleas , the heart-rending shouts that split the night air -- suffering human beings screeching their injustice at the outside world .
Ministers decided the worsening Yugoslav crisis demanded that Britain play a bigger role in the heart-rending task to help two million starving people .
Very often the last journeys of these beloved objects were accomplished to the tune of distressing protests , or of heart-rending pleas for clemency .

The colours appear at little windows in the side , glimpses into the worlds of heart-rending blueness and greenness , unattainable redness and blackness , that lie hidden inside the smooth nickel barrel .
You would n't remember Elizabeth Berner , but she had a fragile charm with heart-rending appeal .
He beat the air with his hands and made the most heart-rending cries .
Pity about the tiny audience for your heart-rending portrayal of genteel poverty and devotion .
If that was your misguided attempt to make an appealing , heart-rending entrance into my life , you 've failed .
` Tina , darling , perhaps it 's time -- " Lucenzo swore as Katarina interrupted him with a heart-rending wail .
The college has had the heart-rending task of choosing between applications from equally deserving cases .
The very air was charged with a terrible heart-rending loneliness .
Nurses who found her were reduced to tears when they read a heart-rending note pinned to her dress .
